member.name: M:VXelementsApi.IVXelements.GetGuiProperty(VXelementsApi.IVXelements.GuiProperty)
member.summary: Gets a VXelements viewer graphical user interface (GUI) property.
member.param: The property one wants to get.
member.returns: The value of the property one wants to get.
member.remarks:
The properties are: menu, tool bar, status strip, left (scan/session properties) panel, right (device properties) panel, border type and top most status.
Menu, tool bar, status strip and left expando and right panel are on (Value=1) or off (Value=0).
Border is None (Value=0), FixedSingle (Value=1), FixedDialog (Value=2), FixedToolWindow (Value=3), Fixed3D (Value=4), Sizable (Value=5) or SizableToolWindow (Value=6).
According to top most value, the window is normal (Value=0) or top most (Value=1).

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.IVXelements.SetGuiProperty(VXelementsApi.IVXelements.GuiProperty,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a VXelements viewer graphical user interface (GUI) property.
member.param: The property one wants to set.
This is the value of the property (as ) one wants to set.
member.remarks:
The properties are: menu, tool bar, status strip, left (scan/session properties) panel, right (device properties) panel, border type and top most status.
Menu, tool bar, status strip and left expando and right panel are toggled on (Value=1) or off (Value=0).
Border is set to None (Value=0), FixedSingle (Value=1), FixedDialog (Value=2), FixedToolWindow (Value=3), Fixed3D (Value=4), Sizable (Value=5) or SizableToolWindow (Value=6).
Top most will set the window normal (Value=0) or top most (Value=1).GUI elements will be toggled on for any non 0 values.The border will not change if an invalid value is given.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.IVXelements.Exit
member.summary: Exits VXelements.

remarks.para: This method will terminate the running instance of VXelements, disconnecting any client application that is connected.
remarks.note: This method is meant for system integrators. Since it can disrupt the operation of other plug-ins, it must not be used by plug-in developers.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.IVXelements.ExecutingApiVersion
member.summary: Gets the version number of the API from the running instance of VXelement.
member.value: An integer value representing the API version of VXelements.

remarks.para: The executing version number is the build number of the running instance of VXelements.
remarks.note: The API is backward compatible. It is not necessary to recompile the client application when newer versions of VXelements and its API are released. Therefore, this version number can be different from .
When connecting to the API, this number must be higher than or equal to ; otherwise, a exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.IVXelements.ApiVersion
member.summary: Gets the version number of the API from the client interface library.
member.value: An integer value representing the version of the API.

remarks.para: The version number of the API is the build number tagged to the client interface library (VXelementsApi.dll). This number corresponds to the build number of a given release of VXelements.
remarks.note: The API is backward compatible. It is not necessary to recompile the client application when newer versions of VXelements and its API are released. Therefore, this version can be different from .
When connecting to the API, this number must be lower than or equal to ; otherwise, a exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.IVXtrack.HideProjectionViewForm
member.summary: Hides the form containing the projection view.
member.remarks: This view provides three separate graphs corresponding to the models or targets position projected on the XY, XZ and YZ planes. Note: X, Y and Z axes are respectively identified by color red, green and blue.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.IVXtrack.ShowProjectionViewForm
member.summary: Shows a form containing the projection view.
member.remarks: This view provides three separate graphs corresponding to the models or targets position projected on the XY, XZ and YZ planes. Note: X, Y and Z axes are respectively identified by color red, green and blue.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.IVXtrack.HideTableViewForm
member.summary: Hides the form containing the table view.
member.remarks: This view provides a table that lists the position for all selected models and targets which were recorded since the beginning of the tracking process. Each time tracking data is acquired, a new row is added in this table.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.IVXtrack.ShowTableViewForm
member.summary: Shows a form containing the table view.
member.remarks: This view provides a table that lists the position for all selected models and targets which were recorded since the beginning of the tracking process. Each time tracking data is acquired, a new row is added in this table.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.IVXtrack.HideGraphicsViewForm
member.summary: Hides the form containing the graph view.
member.remarks: The graph view displays a graph of recorded measurements in function of the time elapsed since the beginning of the tracking process. One can visualize the movement of a model in term of its translation and rotation, as long as the movement of an individual positionning target in term of its translation.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.IVXtrack.ShowGraphicsViewForm
member.summary: Shows a form containing the graph view.
member.remarks: The graph view displays a graph of recorded measurements in function of the time elapsed since the beginning of the tracking process. One can visualize the movement of a model in term of its translation and rotation, as long as the movement of an individual positionning target in term of its translation.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.IVXtrack.HideModelsStatusForm
member.summary: Hides models status window.
member.remarks: The models status window displays in real-time the pose (translation and rotation) of tracking models. It can also display to position (X,Y,Z) of individual positionning targets used to create a specific model.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.IVXtrack.ShowModelsStatusForm
member.summary: Shows models status window.
member.remarks: The models status window displays in real-time the pose (translation and rotation) of tracking models. It can also display to position (X,Y,Z) of individual positionning targets used to create a specific model.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingParameters.FilterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the filter used to average consecutive recorded poses.
member.param: An integer value representing the filter size.
member.remarks: The valid range goes from 0 (i.e. no filtering) to 30 poses.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingParameters.SamplingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the sampling factor.
member.param: An integer value representing the factor used to sample the recorded data.

remarks.para: The valid range goes from -30 to 7. A negative value will force subsampling while a positive value will force upsampling. The default is 1.
For instance, -30 will do a 30x subsampling and 7 will do a 7x upsampling.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingParameters.AcquisitionRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the image acquisition rate.
member.param: A floating-point value representing the acquisition rate. The default is 30 Hz.

remarks.para: The valid range goes from 1 Hz to 30 Hz.
Depending on your setup, the acquisition rate might be limited to 20 Hz; please contact technical support for further details.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingParameters.TriggerPolarity
member.summary: Gets or sets the trigger polarity used with an external device.
member.value: A value representing the current trigger polarity type.
member.remarks: This parameter is only revelant when an external device is connected to the GPIO port of the C-Track.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the tracking model to a plain text file.
member.param: The name of the file that will be used to store the model data. If null, a dialog box will be shown.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.CenterOriginOffsetOnTargets
member.summary: Centers the origin offset on the model positioning target.

member.name: M:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.SetOriginOffset(VXelementsApi.Types.Point3dFloat,VXelementsApi.Types.Point3dFloat)
member.summary: Sets the origin offset of the model.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.UpdateTargetPositionWhileTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the position of the targets in the model should be updated while tracking.
member.value: true when the position of each target of the model is updated automatically while tracking; otherwise, false. The default is true.

remarks.para: This property is only used when is set to NonRigid.

Setting this value to true will update the position of the tracked targets at each frame. Setting this value to false will keep the position of the targets at their latest updated positions or their detected position when the model was created.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.MaximalNumberOfFramesForTargetOccultation
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximal number of frames that a target of the model can be hidden or occulted.
member.value: An integer representing the maximal number of frames that a target can be hidden or occulted.

remarks.para: This property is only used when is set to NonRigid.

When a target of the model has not been seen for this number of frames, the target is considered lost and is no longer tracked. This won't change the tracking status of the other targets of the model.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.MaximalTargetDisplacementBetweenFrames
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximal displacement allowed for a target of the model between two frames.
member.value: A floating-point value representing the maximal displacement allowed for a target of the model between two frames. The value is expressed in millimeters.

remarks.para: This property is only used when is set to NonRigid.
When the displacement of a target between two frames is greater than this value, the target is no longer tracked.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.OriginOffset
member.summary: Gets the origin offset used for the model.
member.value: An object representing the offset to be applied on the origin.

remarks.para: This property is only used when is set to Rigid.
The offset can be expressed as a pose, a rotation or a translation.
Changing the property might change this value.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.MinimumNumberOfTargetsToDetect
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimal number of positioning targets which must be seen in order to detect the tracking model.
member.value: An integer representing the minimum number of targets to be seen.

remarks.para: This property is only used when is set to Rigid.
The minimum number of targets must be greater than or equal to 3.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.Targets
member.summary: Gets an array containing the positioning targets of the model.
member.value: An array of with the positioning targets for the model.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.ModelType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the model.
member.value: One of the model types available.

remarks.para: Switching types will not reset properties to their default values.
Switching from Rigid to NonRigid will automatically center origin offsets on targets, overwriting the information in .

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.TrackingModelType.NonRigid
member.summary: The model is tracked as a set of targets that move independently of each other. Each target of the model is tracked independently.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.TrackingModelType.Rigid
member.summary: The model is tracked as a rigid body. The location and orientation of the model can change but the shape of the target pattern is not affected. Therefore, targets cannot move independently of each other.

member.name: T:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel.TrackingModelType
member.summary: Specifies the types of tracking models supported by the tracking module.

member.name: T:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingModel
member.summary: The ITrackingModel interface derives from the ITrackingEntity interface. It provides functionalities specifically related to tracking models.
member.remarks: These functionalities include retrieving the positioning targets used to create the model, center the origin on those targets, save the tracking model into file, etc.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingEntity.TrackingEntityType.Model

member.name: T:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingEntity.TrackingEntityType
member.summary: Specifies the types of tracking entities supported by the tracking module.

member.name: T:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ITrackingEntity
member.summary: The ITrackingEntity interface provides information about the name or the type of a specific tracking entity.
member.remarks: A tracking entity can either be a tracking model or a relation between two tracking models.

member.name: T:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ReferencingMode
member.summary: Specifies the possible referencing modes of the tracking system.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ReferencingMode.Automatic
member.summary: The reference system is automatically toggled between static and dynamic depending on the visibility of the positioning model at any given time.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ReferencingMode.Dynamic
member.summary: The reference system is the positioning model, which is tracked dynamically.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ReferencingMode.Static
member.summary: The reference system is a snapshot of the current positioning model.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.ReferencingMode.Sensor
member.summary: The reference system is the tracker itself.

member.name: T:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.TriggerPolarityType
member.summary: Specifies the polarity of the triggering system of the tracker.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.TriggerPolarityType.Low
member.summary: The tracker will be activated on the falling edge of the trigger signal.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.TriggerPolarityType.High
member.summary: The tracker will be activated on the rising edge of the trigger signal.

member.name: T:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.TriggerType
member.summary: Specifies possible ways to control the trigger signal of the tracker.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.TriggerType.Slave
member.summary: The trigger will be controlled by an external device.

member.name: F:VXelementsApi.VXtrack.TriggerType.Master
member.summary: The trigger will be controlled by the internal clock of the tracker.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXprobe.IVXprobe.CurrentProbePosition
member.summary: Gets the current position of the probe. Inaccurate for measurements.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXprobe.IVXprobe.ToggleProbingModeWithProbe
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the probing mode can be toggled by clicking and holding the cancel button of the HandyPROBE for a second.
member.value: true if the probing mode can be toggled with the cancel button of the HandyPROBE; otherwise, false. The default is false.

remarks.para: In the previous version of the API, it was possible to switch the probing mode by clicking and holding the cancel button of the HandyPROBE for a second. It is possible to get back this behavior by setting the property to true.
remarks.note: Setting this property to true will disable the triggering of events.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXscan.IVXscan.IsTextureSupported
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the VXscan module supports textures with the connected scanner.
member.value: true if the VXscan module can acquire texture with the connected scanner; otherwise, false.

remarks.note: The value of this property depends on the capabilities of the connected scanner.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXscan.IVXscan.PointScanEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the availability of point reconstruction to the connected plug-ins.
member.value: true if the reconstruction of a model as points is available to plug-ins; otherwise, false. The default is false.

remarks.para: This property controls the availability of the point scan feature to the plug-ins. When set to true, point reconstruction is available to the client application and the scanning window; otherwise, the option will not be available in the scanning window and any operation requesting a surface will fail.
remarks.note: When the property is set to false, the property will automatically change to SurfaceScan if the mode is enabled.
When is false, this property is false and cannot be changed.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXscan.IVXscan.IsPointScanSupported
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the VXscan module supports the point reconstruction of a model with the connected scanner.
member.value: true if the VXscan module can reconstruct a scanned model as points with the connected scanner; otherwise, false.

remarks.note: The value of this property depends on the capabilities of the connected scanner.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXscan.IVXscan.SurfaceScanEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the availability of surface reconstruction to the connected plug-ins.
member.value: true if the reconstruction of a model as a surface is available to plug-ins; otherwise, false. The default is true.

remarks.para: This property controls the availability of the surface scan feature to the plug-ins. When set to true, surface reconstruction is available to the client application and the scanning window; otherwise, the option will not be available in the scanning window and any operation requesting a surface will fail.
remarks.note: When the property is set to false, the property will automatically change to PointScan if the mode is enabled.
When is false, this property is false and cannot be changed.

member.name: P:VXelementsApi.VXscan.IVXscan.IsSurfaceScanSupported

member.value: true if the VXscan module can reconstruct a scanned model as a surface with the connected scanner; otherwise, false.

remarks.note: The value of this property depends on the capabilities of the connected scanner.

member.name: T:VXelementsApi.VXeventInvoker
member.summary: Represents a wrapper around a delegate that can execute any method in managed code that is declared void and takes no parameters.

remarks.para: By design, VXelementsApi uses a custom event system for interface classes. The syntax is similar to the events and delegates system in the .NET framework.
is a wrapper around a delegate function. A object can be attached to a event. When a is triggered, it will invoke the objects attached to the event; each will then invoke its associated delegate.
remarks.note: Consult the API manual for more information on the custom event system.

example.para: The following code examples demonstrates how to attach a object to a event of a object.
example.code: Dim lpActiveProbeChangedEvent As VXelementsApi.VXeventInvoker lpActiveProbeChangedEvent = New VXelementsApi.VXeventInvoker(New VXelementsApi.VXeventHandler(AddressOf Class.Method)) VXelementsApi.ApiManager.VXelements.VXprobe.ActiveProbeChanged.AddEvent(lpActiveProbeChangedEvent)
